Upcoming and rising, primarily a residential neighborhood in the Mimo District,  this 4/1 home is a diamond in the rough opportunity to be in this happening region, minutes from Miami's Wynwood District. Spacious open living area and large back yard. The Upper East Side is composed largely of historic single-family homes from the 1920s, 1930s, and 1940s, with Biscayne Boulevard running along the center of the neighborhood with mid-rise and high-rise office towers, hotels, and apartments. The MiMo Historic District runs along Biscayne Boulevard, and includes a large number of MiMo hotels from the 1950s and 1960s, that have been preserved, and have recently begun to be renovated, and turned into stores, restaurants and boutique hotels.- Wikipedia
